meanings.definition: Of or relating to a column
meanings.sent1: The columnistic design of the building's facade was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greek architecture featured columnistic structures.
meanings.sent3: The columnistic pillars in the garden seemed to be chatting with each other.
meanings.sent4: The row of columnistic trees stood tall like guardians of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The columnistic pattern on the wallpaper added a touch of elegance to the room.

meanings.sent1: The columnistic shape of the monument was striking against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The columnistic details on the building's facade were intricate.
meanings.sent3: The columnistic appearance of the cake made it look like a delicious pillar.
meanings.sent4: The columnistic rows of books in the library seemed to reach the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The columnistic structure of the bridge provided strong support for the traffic above.

meanings.definition: Written in the style of a column
meanings.sent1: The columnistic article in the newspaper discussed current events.
meanings.sent2: The magazine featured a columnistic piece on fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The columnistic story in the book made the reader chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The columnistic blog post was filled with interesting anecdotes.
meanings.sent5: The columnistic writing style of the author was engaging and informative.
